intro: Dichromena ciliata var. vahliana, commonly known as the hairy dichromena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with ciliate margins. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
